intro: Verticordia insignis subsp. compta, commonly known as the Geraldton waxplant, is a species native to the south-western region of Western Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive, candle-like flowers that range in color from pink to red, often with a waxy appearance. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to the dry, Mediterranean climate of its native habitat. It is a member of the family Myrtaceae and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. The subspecies compta is distinguished by its more compact growth form compared to other subspecies of Verticordia.
